page.title: 14THE BARRACKS
page.content: The barracks are situated south east of the church, on the opposite side of the road. The barracks are made of red brick and are a part of a 14 acre field. The barracks were built about 1939 to 1940. The roof in the air-raid shelter is held up by wooden or iron beams. There is an air raid shelter with a fire place and a passage which has been blocked up. In the air raid shelter there are iron steps going to the roof. The shelters are in very dim light and one room was much darker than the others. Several of the shelters are surrounded by dence undergrowth which makes access extremely difficult. The barracks were the home of the Allied Forces. Apparently this was the only gunning implacement in Barrow that shot down an enemy plane during the second world war.
